summary: Premium Airport Lounge Face Recognition Entry System – a modern, professional web interface inspired by premium airline websites (Qatar Airways aesthetic) with scroll-driven workflow stages (Hero, Face Detection, AI Processing, Verification Result, Access Confirmation), light theme with white/soft grey backgrounds, elegant airline-style layout, spacious sections, professional typography, smooth scrolling transitions, and minimal animations. Navigation contains only: Live Entry, Member Management, Entry Logs, Security & System Status.
architectural_notes: Light theme: white/soft light grey backgrounds, professional blue accent, green for success, red for alerts
Scroll-driven experience: 5 sections (Introduction, Face Detection, AI Processing, Verification Result, Access Authorization) as guided product walkthrough
Top navigation bar with: Live Entry, Member Management, Entry Logs, Security & System Status
Verification result panel shows: Passenger Name, Membership Tier, Confidence Score, Verification Time, and Access Granted/Denied status
Subtle shadows/elevation for depth; no excessive animations or futuristic effects; responsive layout
Visual inspiration: premium airline websites (Qatar Airways style) — spacious sections, strong alignment, calm/trustworthy aesthetic; no booking/travel/login features
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Photorealistic premium airport lounge interior with warm lighting, plush seating, large windows with runway view, and a calm upscale atmosphere (lounge-hero.dim_1920x1080.jpg)

existing_features.title: Implement a light-theme visual design system throughout the entire application using white and soft light grey (#F8F9FA) backgrounds, professional blue (#1E3A8A / #2563EB) as the primary accent color, green (#16A34A) for success states, red (#DC2626) for alert/denied states, and neutral dark grey (#1F2937) for body text. Apply clean sans-serif typography (Inter or similar), consistent spacing, subtle box shadows for elevation, and a minimalistic layout that resembles enterprise airport or airline management software.

Create a fixed top navigation bar with the application name/logo on the left and four navigation links on the right: 'Live Entry', 'Member Management', 'Entry Logs', and 'Security & System Status'. The navbar should be white with a bottom border shadow, remain sticky on scroll, and highlight the active section link.

Build Section 1 (Introduction): A full-viewport-height hero section with the airport lounge background image (lounge-hero.dim_1920x1080.jpg) as a background, a semi-transparent overlay, the title 'Premium Lounge AI – Face Recognition Entry System' in large bold text, a short system description paragraph (e.g., 'Seamlessly verify premium members with AI-powered biometric recognition — fast, secure, and contactless'), and a subtle scroll-down indicator arrow.

Build Section 2 (Face Detection Stage): A full-height section labeled 'Live Entry' showing a camera interface layout centered on the page. Render a simulated camera viewfinder as a large rounded rectangle with a subtle pulsing blue border. Inside the viewfinder, display a face detection bounding box (a rectangular bracket overlay) to simulate face tracking, and a label below reading 'Detecting Passenger Face' with a pulsing status dot. The section background should be soft light grey.

Build Section 3 (AI Processing Stage): A full-height section showing a vertical workflow pipeline with three steps displayed as cards or steps: (1) 'Capturing Image', (2) 'Extracting Facial Features', (3) 'Matching with Premium Member Database'. Each step should have an icon, a step label, and a subtle horizontal progress bar beneath it. Steps should visually indicate sequential progression (e.g., completed steps in blue/green, current step with an animated progress indicator, pending steps in grey).

Build Section 4 (Verification Result Stage): A full-height section displaying a passenger information panel as a white card with shadow. The card must show: Passenger Name, Membership Tier (e.g., Platinum, Gold), Confidence Score (e.g., 98.7%), and Verification Time (e.g., 1.2s). Below the card, display a large status badge: 'Access Granted' in green or 'Access Denied' in red, with a corresponding icon (checkmark or X). The demo should default to showing 'Access Granted'. Include a toggle button to switch between Granted/Denied states for demonstration purposes.

Build Section 5 (Access Authorization Stage): A full-height section with a centered, clean success layout. Display a large green checkmark icon, the confirmation message 'Access Authorized – Welcome to Premium Lounge' in bold large text, and a secondary line such as 'Gate opens automatically. Please proceed to the lounge.' Below, show a simple green 'Entry Logged' badge and a timestamp. Background should be white.

Build a 'Member Management' page/view accessible from the top navigation. Display a searchable data table of premium members with columns: Member ID, Name, Membership Tier, Status (Active/Suspended), and Last Entry date. Include mock data for at least 8 members. Add an 'Add Member' button that opens a simple modal form with fields for Name, Membership Tier (dropdown), and Status.

Build an 'Entry Logs' page/view accessible from the top navigation. Display a table of recent entry events with columns: Timestamp, Passenger Name, Membership Tier, Confidence Score, and Result (Granted/Denied). Results should be color-coded green/red. Include at least 10 mock log entries. Add a date-range filter and a result filter (All / Granted / Denied).

Build a 'Security & System Status' page/view accessible from the top navigation. Display a status dashboard with: (1) System Health cards for Camera Feed, AI Engine, and Database Connection, each showing an 'Online' (green) or 'Offline' (red) status badge; (2) Key metrics: Total Entries Today, Granted Count, Denied Count, Average Confidence Score; (3) A simple bar or metric card showing peak entry times. Use mock static data.

Implement scroll-driven section transitions on the main scroll page (Live Entry workflow). As the user scrolls through Sections 1–5, each section should smoothly animate into view (fade-in + subtle upward slide). Use Intersection Observer API or a scroll library to trigger entrance animations. Transitions must be smooth and professional — no abrupt jumps, no excessive effects. Scroll progress through the workflow sections should feel like a guided product walkthrough.

Ensure the entire interface is fully responsive. The navigation bar should collapse into a hamburger menu on mobile viewports. All section layouts (viewfinder, workflow steps, verification card, tables) must reflow gracefully on tablet and mobile screen widths. Font sizes should scale appropriately.

Refine the overall visual design to more closely reflect the premium airline aesthetic of carriers like Qatar Airways. This includes: increasing section vertical padding and whitespace for a more spacious, luxurious feel; upgrading typography weight and letter-spacing on headings for an upscale editorial look; adding subtle warm undertones (e.g., soft champagne/gold accent alongside the existing primary blue) to borders, dividers, or section separators to evoke premium airline branding; ensuring all cards use consistent refined box shadows and slightly increased border-radius; and polishing the hero section overlay, fonts, and layout to feel on par with a premium airline homepage hero.

Redesign the top navigation bar to match the premium airline style: use a slim, elegant bar with generous horizontal padding; display the logo/brand name using a refined serif or semi-bold sans-serif font; apply a thin bottom border in a subtle gold or light grey tone; ensure nav links use slightly spaced uppercase or small-caps styling with a clean underline or dot indicator on the active link; and remove any visual clutter so only the four links ('Live Entry', 'Member Management', 'Entry Logs', 'Security & System Status') are present.

Polish the hero section (IntroductionSection) to more closely resemble a premium airline homepage hero: ensure the lounge background image fills the full viewport height with a refined gradient overlay (dark at bottom, lighter at top) rather than a flat overlay; position the headline 'Premium Lounge AI – Face Recognition Entry System' in large, bold, elegant typography (min 3.5rem on desktop); add a short professional tagline below it; include one clean call-to-action button with airline-style outline or solid styling; and add a subtle animated scroll-down chevron at the bottom center.

Improve the scroll-driven workflow sections (Face Detection, AI Processing, Verification Result, Access Authorization) to feel like a guided premium product walkthrough: add section labels/eyebrow text (e.g., 'STAGE 01 — FACE DETECTION') in small caps or uppercase tracking above each section heading; ensure consistent section structure with a left-aligned or centered headline, a short descriptor paragraph, and the main content block below; apply entrance animations (fade-in + subtle upward slide) with staggered delays so content elements within each section animate in sequence rather than all at once.
